channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Counseling Center Announces Walk-in Counseling Hours for Fall 2024
item.description: Rensselaer’s Counseling Center invites students to meet with a counselor without a formal appointment, during designated walk-in hours. There are two hours available for walk-in each day: (M/W/F - 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.; T/Th - 2 to 4 p.m.). Walk-in counseling is available on a first-come, first-served basis on days when classes are in session. Students who cannot attend walk-in times can call (518) 276-6479 to schedule an appointment….
item.author: Students

item.title: Covid-19 Guidance for Fall 2024
item.description: Covid-19 continues to affect our community, requiring us to adapt and change our protocols in response to evolving knowledge about the virus and changes in population immunity and susceptibility. Please read for details on what to do if you get sick, as well as prevention, testing, treatment, and other on-campus protocols.
item.author: Students

item.title: ASCE to Hold Student Chapter Meeting
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - All majors are invited to come hang out with the student chapter of the American Society of Civil Engineers. It’s a great way to catch up with old friends, meet new people, play games, and have some pizza!
item.author: Students

item.title: Sign-Ups for September 11 CCPD Fall Resumania Still Available!
item.description: Join CCPD for the Fall 2024 Resumaniam which will take place from noon to 3:00PM on Wednesday, September 11. During this event, students will have the opportunity to have their resume reviewed by employers or career counseling staff for a 15-minute segment, so sign up for your 15-minute time slot today!
item.author: Students

item.title: AWM Virtual Seminar, “Breaking the Code: Careers in the Intelligence Community,” Scheduled for September 13
item.description: The AWM virtual seminar, “Breaking the Code: Careers in the Intelligence Community,” will take place from 4:00PM to 5:30PM ET on Friday, September 13 and will feature a panel of experts working in the Intelligence Community. This seminar is part of a series intended to connect AWM student chapter members with working mathematicians, and which will answer questions about the day-to-day lives of mathematicians working in various sectors.
item.author: Students

item.title: Fellowship info Session to Highlight Competitions for Grad School Salary and Tuition
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Competitive fellowships provide salary and tuition for Masters and PhD students. All graduate students, juniors, seniors, and international students are welcome to attend this session to learn how to find and apply to appropriate programs that will fund fall 2025 and beyond. Register to attend or just drop in!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Wellness Wednesday” Series Kicks Off September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - A program dedicated to enhancing student health and wellbeing, Wellness Wednesdays offer a diverse range of activities and information sessions that focus on crucial life skills and aim to equip students with practical knowledge for maintaining physical, mental, and financial wellness throughout their college journey and beyond.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Build a Better Budget” Webinar Scheduled for September 10
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - As part of The Off-Campus Commons Financial Series, Student Living and Learning has partnered with Broadview Federal Credit Union to present this webinar to help participants get ready to take control of their finances and their future. Enrollment is limited, so be sure to register to reserve your spot!
item.author: Students

item.title: Enjoy Games, Cider, and Cookies with APO!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM - Come join the brothers of APO for a public fellowship event featuring fall treats!
item.author: Students

item.title: CCPD, ISSS to Hold “Working in the U.S.: CPT and Internships” Webinar for Undergraduate Students
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Join the Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) and International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for a virtual workshop to learn about the internship search and the ways to get Curricular Practical Training (CPT) to work in the U.S. before graduation! This session has information that is specific to undergraduate students.
item.author: Students

item.title: iEar Presents Guest Speaker Oron Catts
item.description: This talk with Oron Catts will explore and unpack artistic projects that deals with the ways current applications of biological knowledge confuse our cultural understanding and relationships with the concepts of life, nature and land. Join us at 5pm-6:30pm on September 10 in the CBIS Auditorium.
item.author: Community

item.title: Mercer XLab Grand Renovation Opening Event to be Held September 25
item.description: Attend this event featuring the Douglas A. Mercer ’77 Innovation and Exploration Laboratory ribbon-cutting ceremony, an XCorridor of Student Creativity and Community reception with refreshments served, and a panel discussion on the convergence of AI and higher education regarding human behavior.
item.author: Community

item.title: “See What’s New in CAS SciFinder” Webinar Slated for September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - During this vendor-hosted session, CAS SciFinder experts will walk participants through recent solution enhancements, going in-depth to helping them understand how to take advantage of newly released features and the overall impact on researching in CAS SciFinder. Attend this session to see how these enhancements improve existing workflows, and ask questions specific to your research!
item.author: Community

item.title: CMDIS to Host Facilities Open House September 11
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM - Center for Materials, Devices and Integrated Systems (CMDIS) invites you to their Facilities Open House, which will be followed by a BBQ! Please sign up by September 9 for facility tours to learn about tools, instrumentation capabilities, fabrication and characterization techniques, and much more.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Community
